location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Sketch Map of the Eastern Arabian Peninsula

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Manuscript; black ink and crayon on paper.Dimensions: 328 x 204mm.

mods.abstract: Map depicting the eastern Arabian Peninsula. The map, which was prepared in anticipation of frontier negotiations with the Saudi Arabian Government, shows possible lines for the south-eastern Saudi Arabian border, as proposed by the Foreign Office.A blue line, drawn in blue crayon and descending from slightly west of Qatar, represents the 'blue line', a boundary line agreed between the British Government and the Ottoman Empire in the Anglo-Ottoman Convention (1913). A second blue line further to the east represents one possible boundary. A third line, drawn in red crayon, shows another possible concession; this line includes a portion of a larger 'desert zone'.
